mads:mads.mads:note: Its English. The Major declamations ascribed to Quintilian, 1987: t.p. (The Major declamations ascribed to Quintilian)
LC PA classification schedule (Quintilianus, M. Fabius, ca. 35-ca. 95 A.D. (Declamationes (spurious)))

Grant, M. Greek and Latin authors, 1980: under Quintilian (two volumes of rhetorical exercises (Declamationes) that survive may be transcripts of his lecture courses made by his students; if so, they do not necessarily reflect Quintilian's views)
Kleine Pauly: under Quintilian (Declamationes maiores and Declamationes minores pass under Quintilian's name, but the attribution is scarcely credible)

Oxford classical dict., 1970 (Declamationes Pseudo-Quintilianeae; 2 sets of rhetorical pieces ascribed by the manuscripts to Quintilian; to Quintilian; there are 19 Declamationes maiores; the Declamationes minores are the last 145 of a collection originally numbering 388)
